verses.roman:
tebhyo dadhāra kanye dve
vayunāṁ dhāriṇīṁ svadhā
ubhe te brahma-vādinyau
jñāna-vijñāna-pārage

synonyms: tebhyaḥ—from them; dadhāra—produced; kanye—daughters; dve—two; vayunām—Vayunā; dhāriṇīm—Dhāriṇī; svadhā—Svadhā; ubhe—both of them; te—they; brahma-vādinyau—impersonalists; jñāna-vijñāna-pāra-ge—expert in both transcendental and Vedic knowledge.
translation: Svadhā, who was offered to the Pitās, begot two daughters named Vayunā and Dhāriṇī, both of whom were impersonalists and were expert in transcendental and Vedic knowledge.
